intro: Selenicereus maxonii, commonly known as the night-blooming cereus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stem covered in spines. The plant produces large, fragrant white flowers that open at night, emitting a strong scent to attract pollinators such as moths. Its flowers typically bloom only once a year, making it a rare and striking sight. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well adapted to arid environments.
